Class EndgameBoardEvaluator

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.forAI.EndgameBoardEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardEvaluator
public class EndgameBoardEvaluator extends Object implements BoardEvaluator
The EndgameBoardEvaluator class provides specialized evaluation functions for chess endgame positions. This evaluator focuses on endgame-specific factors such as king activity, passed pawns, pawn structure, and piece coordination that become critical when few pieces remain on the board. The evaluation considers material balance, king centralization, pawn promotion potential, and various endgame patterns to provide accurate position assessments for late-game scenarios.
Author:
Aaron Ho

    • get

      public static EndgameBoardEvaluator get()
      Returns the singleton instance of EndgameBoardEvaluator.
      Returns:
      The instance of EndgameBoardEvaluator.

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(Board board, int depth)
      Evaluates the given board from the perspective of both players and returns a score. The evaluation considers endgame-specific factors and returns a positive score when white has an advantage and a negative score when black has an advantage.
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface BoardEvaluator
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      depth - The search depth in the AI's thinking process.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score of the board position.

    • score

      private double score(Player player, Board board)
      Calculates the overall score of the current board position for a given player using modern chess engine evaluation principles tuned for endgame positions. The evaluation combines material assessment, king activity, passed pawn evaluation, pawn structure analysis, piece coordination, and endgame-specific patterns.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the board position is being evaluated.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score of the board from the perspective of the specified player.

    • materialEvaluation

      private double materialEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates material balance with specific endgame piece values and recognizes special endgame material combinations. This method applies endgame-specific piece values and identifies patterns like insufficient material or favorable material combinations.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose material is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The material evaluation score for the player.

    • countPieceTypes

      private Map<Piece.PieceType,Integer> countPieceTypes(Collection<Piece> pieces)
      Counts the number of each piece type in the given collection of pieces.
      Parameters:
      pieces - The collection of pieces to count.
      Returns:
      A map containing the count of each piece type.

    • isDeepEndgame

      private boolean isDeepEndgame(Board board)
      Checks if the position is in a deep endgame state with few pieces remaining. A deep endgame is characterized by having 4 or fewer non-pawn, non-king pieces.
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board.
      Returns:
      True if the position is in a deep endgame, false otherwise.

    • isInsufficientMaterial

      private boolean isInsufficientMaterial(Map<Piece.PieceType,Integer> playerPieceCounts, Map<Piece.PieceType,Integer> opponentPieceCounts)
      Checks for insufficient material to force checkmate. This includes positions like king versus king, king and minor piece versus king, or king and two knights versus king.
      Parameters:
      playerPieceCounts - The piece counts for the player.
      opponentPieceCounts - The piece counts for the opponent.
      Returns:
      True if insufficient material exists, false otherwise.

    • evaluateSpecialMaterialCombinations

      private boolean evaluateSpecialMaterialCombinations(Map<Piece.PieceType,Integer> playerPieceCounts, Map<Piece.PieceType,Integer> opponentPieceCounts, Alliance playerAlliance)
      Evaluates special material combinations that could be advantageous in the endgame. This includes combinations like queen versus rook, rook versus minor piece, or bishop pair versus knight.
      Parameters:
      playerPieceCounts - The piece counts for the player.
      opponentPieceCounts - The piece counts for the opponent.
      playerAlliance - The alliance of the player being evaluated.
      Returns:
      True if the player has a favorable material combination, false otherwise.

    • hasOppositeColoredBishops

      private boolean hasOppositeColoredBishops(Collection<Piece> playerPieces, Collection<Piece> opponentPieces)
      Checks if the position has opposite-colored bishops, which often leads to drawish tendencies in the endgame.
      Parameters:
      playerPieces - The player's pieces.
      opponentPieces - The opponent's pieces.
      Returns:
      True if opposite-colored bishops exist, false otherwise.

    • kingActivityEvaluation

      private double kingActivityEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates king activity, which is a critical factor in endgames. Active kings that can participate in the game by attacking pawns, supporting their own pawns, or controlling key squares are highly valued in endgame positions.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose king activity is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The king activity evaluation score.

    • evaluateKingCentralization

      private double evaluateKingCentralization(int kingPosition)
      Evaluates king centralization, which is crucial in endgames. Kings positioned near the center of the board are generally more active and effective.
      Parameters:
      kingPosition - The position of the king on the board.
      Returns:
      The centralization score for the king.

    • evaluateKingProximity

      private double evaluateKingProximity(int kingPosition, int opponentKingPosition)
      Evaluates king proximity to the opponent king, which is important in certain endgames, particularly king and pawn endings where opposition matters.
      Parameters:
      kingPosition - The position of the player's king.
      opponentKingPosition - The position of the opponent's king.
      Returns:
      The proximity evaluation score.

    • evaluateKingPawnDefense

      private double evaluateKingPawnDefense(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates how well the king defends friendly pawns and attacks enemy pawns. In endgames, kings become active pieces that should participate in both defense and attack operations.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose king-pawn cooperation is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The king-pawn defense evaluation score.

    • evaluateKingExposure

      private double evaluateKingExposure(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates king exposure to checks and attacks. While less critical in endgames than in middlegames, king safety is still relevant, especially when queens remain on the board.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose king safety is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The king exposure evaluation score.

    • passedPawnEvaluation

      private double passedPawnEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates passed pawns, which are especially important in endgames due to their promotion potential. This evaluation considers pawn advancement, king support, and path clearance to the promotion square.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose passed pawns are being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The passed pawn evaluation score.

    • isPassedPawn

      private boolean isPassedPawn(Piece pawn, List<Piece> opponentPawns, Alliance alliance)
      Checks if a pawn is a passed pawn by verifying that no opposing pawns block its path to promotion on the same file or adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The pawn to check.
      opponentPawns - The opponent's pawns.
      alliance - The alliance of the pawn being checked.
      Returns:
      True if the pawn is passed, false otherwise.

    • isPawnAtPosition

      private boolean isPawnAtPosition(List<Piece> pawns, int position)
      Checks if there is a pawn at the specified position in the given list of pawns.
      Parameters:
      pawns - The list of pawns to search.
      position - The position to check.
      Returns:
      True if a pawn exists at the position, false otherwise.

    • isPathToPromotionClear

      private boolean isPathToPromotionClear(Piece pawn, Alliance alliance, Board board)
      Checks if the path to promotion is clear of all pieces, not just pawns. This is important for evaluating the immediate promotion potential of passed pawns.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The pawn whose promotion path is being checked.
      alliance - The alliance of the pawn.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      True if the path is clear, false otherwise.

    • isPawnProtected

      private boolean isPawnProtected(Piece pawn, List<Piece> playerPawns, Alliance alliance)
      Checks if a pawn is protected by another pawn of the same alliance. Protected passed pawns are generally more valuable than unprotected ones.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The pawn to check for protection.
      playerPawns - The list of friendly pawns.
      alliance - The alliance of the pawn.
      Returns:
      True if the pawn is protected, false otherwise.

    • evaluateConnectedPassedPawns

      private double evaluateConnectedPassedPawns(List<Piece> playerPawns, List<Piece> opponentPawns, Alliance alliance)
      Evaluates connected passed pawns, which are extremely powerful in endgames. Connected passed pawns are adjacent pawns that are both passed and can support each other's advancement.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      opponentPawns - The opponent's pawns.
      alliance - The alliance of the pawns being evaluated.
      Returns:
      The connected passed pawns evaluation score.

    • pawnStructureEvaluation

      private double pawnStructureEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates pawn structure factors that are particularly important in endgames, including pawn islands, isolated pawns, doubled pawns, and pawn majorities.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawn structure is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The pawn structure evaluation score.

    • evaluatePawnIslands

      private double evaluatePawnIslands(List<Piece> playerPawns)
      Evaluates pawn islands, which are groups of connected pawns separated by files without pawns. Fewer pawn islands are generally better.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      Returns:
      The pawn islands evaluation score.

    • evaluateDoubledPawns

      private double evaluateDoubledPawns(List<Piece> playerPawns)
      Evaluates doubled pawns, which are multiple pawns on the same file. Doubled pawns are generally considered a weakness, especially in endgames.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      Returns:
      The doubled pawns evaluation score.

    • evaluateIsolatedPawns

      private double evaluateIsolatedPawns(List<Piece> playerPawns)
      Evaluates isolated pawns, which are pawns with no friendly pawns on adjacent files. Isolated pawns are particularly weak in endgames.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      Returns:
      The isolated pawns evaluation score.

    • isOnOpenFile

      private boolean isOnOpenFile(Piece pawn, List<Piece> pawns)
      Checks if a pawn is on an open file with no other pawns of the same alliance.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The pawn to check.
      pawns - The list of pawns to compare against.
      Returns:
      True if the pawn is on an open file, false otherwise.

    • evaluatePawnMajorities

      private double evaluatePawnMajorities(List<Piece> playerPawns, List<Piece> opponentPawns)
      Evaluates pawn majorities on different sides of the board. Having more pawns on one side of the board can be advantageous for creating passed pawns.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      opponentPawns - The opponent's pawns.
      Returns:
      The pawn majorities evaluation score.

    • evaluatePawnChains

      private double evaluatePawnChains(List<Piece> playerPawns)
      Evaluates pawn chains, which are connected pawns that protect each other. Pawn chains provide mutual support and are generally advantageous.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      Returns:
      The pawn chains evaluation score.

    • isPawnProtectingFile

      private boolean isPawnProtectingFile(Map<Integer,Set<Integer>> pawnsByRank, int rank, int file)
      Checks if a pawn is protected by another pawn on an adjacent file.
      Parameters:
      pawnsByRank - A map of pawns organized by rank.
      rank - The rank of the pawn being checked.
      file - The file of the pawn being checked.
      Returns:
      True if the pawn is protected, false otherwise.

      alliance - The alliance of the pawns.
      Returns:
      The backward pawns evaluation score.

      The piece placement evaluation score.

    • evaluateBishopPlacement

      private double evaluateBishopPlacement(Bishop bishop, List<Piece> playerPawns)
      Evaluates bishop placement relative to pawns. Bishops positioned behind pawns on long diagonals are generally well-placed.
      Parameters:
      bishop - The bishop to evaluate.
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      Returns:
      The bishop placement evaluation score.

    • evaluateKnightPlacement

      private double evaluateKnightPlacement(Knight knight, List<Piece> playerPawns)
      Evaluates knight placement relative to pawns. Knights positioned near pawns are generally more effective in endgames.
      Parameters:
      knight - The knight to evaluate.
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      Returns:
      The knight placement evaluation score.

    • evaluatePiecesSupportingPassedPawns

      Parameters:
      player - The player whose piece support is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.

      The piece support evaluation score.

    • rookEndgameEvaluation

      private double rookEndgameEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates rook-specific endgame patterns, including rook activity on open files, rook placement behind passed pawns, and rook coordination.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose rook endgame factors are being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The rook endgame evaluation score.

    • evaluateRookOnOpenFile

      private double evaluateRookOnOpenFile(Piece rook, Board board)
      Evaluates rooks on open or semi-open files, which are generally advantageous positions for rooks in endgames.
      Parameters:
      rook - The rook to evaluate.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The rook file evaluation score.

    • evaluateRookBehindPassedPawn

      private double evaluateRookBehindPassedPawn(Piece rook, List<Piece> playerPawns, List<Piece> opponentPawns, Alliance alliance)
      Evaluates rooks behind passed pawns, following the Tarrasch rule that rooks belong behind passed pawns to support their advancement.
      Parameters:
      rook - The rook to evaluate.
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      opponentPawns - The opponent's pawns.

    • evaluateRookOn7thRank

      private double evaluateRookOn7thRank(Piece rook, List<Piece> opponentPawns, Alliance alliance)
      Evaluates rooks on the 7th rank (or 2nd rank for black), which is often a very strong position in endgames for attacking pawns and restricting the king.
      Parameters:
      rook - The rook to evaluate.
      opponentPawns - The opponent's pawns.
      alliance - The alliance of the rook.
      Returns:
      The 7th rank rook evaluation score.

    • evaluateConnectedRooks

      private double evaluateConnectedRooks(List<Piece> playerRooks)
      Evaluates connected rooks that protect each other on the same rank or file. Connected rooks can provide mutual support and control important squares.
      Parameters:
      playerRooks - The player's rooks.
      Returns:
      The connected rooks evaluation score.

    • bishopEndgameEvaluation

      private double bishopEndgameEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates bishop endgame patterns, including color complex control, bishop mobility, and bishop versus knight dynamics.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose bishop endgame factors are being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The bishop endgame evaluation score.

    • evaluateColorComplexControl

      private double evaluateColorComplexControl(List<Piece> playerBishops, Board board)
      Evaluates color complex control, which is important in bishop endgames. Bishops that control squares of the opposite color from most pawns are generally more effective.
      Parameters:
      playerBishops - The player's bishops.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The color complex control evaluation score.

    • evaluateBishopVsKnight

      private double evaluateBishopVsKnight(Board board)
      Evaluates bishop versus knight dynamics in specific positions. Bishops are generally better in open positions while knights prefer closed positions.
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The bishop versus knight evaluation score.

    • drawPatternEvaluation

      private double drawPatternEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates common draw patterns in endgames, including insufficient material, opposite-colored bishops, and other drawish tendencies.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose draw patterns are being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The draw pattern evaluation score.

    • mobilityEvaluation

      private double mobilityEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates mobility, which is less important in many endgames but still relevant for certain positions, particularly with active pieces.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose mobility is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The mobility evaluation score.

    • isPawnEndgame

      private boolean isPawnEndgame(Board board)
      Checks if the position is a pawn endgame with only kings and pawns remaining.
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      True if the position is a pawn endgame, false otherwise.

    • calculateChebyshevDistance

      private int calculateChebyshevDistance(int position1, int position2)
      Calculates the Chebyshev distance between two squares on the chess board. This is the maximum of the horizontal and vertical distances.
      Parameters:
      position1 - The first position.
      position2 - The second position.
      Returns:
      The Chebyshev distance between the positions.

    • getPlayerPawns

      private static List<Piece> getPlayerPawns(Player player)
      Gets a list of pawn pieces for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawns are requested.
      Returns:
      A list of the player's pawn pieces.
